vague_description: Determine the optimal combination of burgers and pizza slices for a man to consume in order to meet his dietary fat and calorie needs while minimizing cholesterol intake and maintaining a specified ratio of pizza slices to burgers.
detailed_description: A doctor recommends that a man eat burgers and pizza in order to put on weight. Each burger contains \param{FatPerBurger} units of fat and \param{CaloriesPerBurger} calories. Each slice of pizza contains \param{FatPerPizzaSlice} units of fat and \param{CaloriesPerPizzaSlice} calories. The man must get at least \param{MinFat} units of fat and \param{MinCalories} calories. Further, each burger contains \param{CholesterolPerBurger} units of cholesterol while each slice of pizza contains \param{CholesterolPerPizzaSlice} units of cholesterol. Since burgers are slightly more expensive, the man decides to eat at least \param{PizzaBurgerRatio} times as many slices of pizza as burgers. How many of each should he eat to minimize his cholesterol intake?
target_objective: Minimize the total cholesterol intake from burgers and pizzas
target_constraints: Total fat from burgers and pizzas is at least MinFat units
Total calories from burgers and pizzas is at least MinCalories calories
The quantity of pizza slices eaten must be at least PizzaBurgerRatio times the quantity of burgers eaten
Number of burgers eaten is non-negative
Number of pizza slices eaten is non-negative
target_parameters: Fat content per slice of pizza
Ratio of the number of pizza slices to the number of burgers
